---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [3bd3372033](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22934/commits/3bd3372033ff6b18be9923b9ab83baade1f4ca3e)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.FieldTheory.Finite.GaloisField | 1554 | 1565 | +11 (+0.71%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.FieldTheory.Finite.Trace`|1|
| `Mathlib.FieldTheory.Cardinality` `Mathlib.FieldTheory.Finite.GaloisField`|11|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ algebraMap_norm_eq_pow`
`+ norm_surjective`
`+ surjective_of_card_ker_le_div`
`+ unitsMap_norm_surjective`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
I feel like `unitsMap_norm_surjective` should follow from a more general fact about homomorphisms of cyclic groups.

I've extracted
```
lemma surjective_of_card_ker_le_div {G M : Type*} [Group G] [Group M] [Finite G] [Finite M]
    (f : G →* M) (h : Nat.card f.ker ≤ Nat.card G / Nat.card M) : Function.Surjective f
```
(which doesn't require cyclicity)
so what remains in this proof is just bounding the order of the kernel which indeed has `IsCyclic.card_pow_eq_one_le` as the central piece.
I guess that the three lines above are needed to make this work; wouldn't it be more reasonable to refactor `Fintype.card_eq_nat_card` to `Finite`?

Most of the file FieldTheory/Finite/Basic.lean (which this PR depends on) is written using `Fintype.card` rather than `Nat.card`. I've [proposed](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/217875-Is-there-code-for-X.3F/topic/Theory.20of.20finite.20fields/near/496994060) a switch to `Nat.card` (so `Fintype` assumptions can be replaced by `Finite`), but don't have the time to implement it.
I'm not sure what's meant by "refactor `Fintype.card_eq_nat_card` to `Finite`" ...
Where is this needed? It seems strange that we need `classical` for this result.

A DecidableEq instance is needed because the statement of [IsCyclic.card_pow_eq_one_le](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/GroupTheory/SpecificGroups/Cyclic.html#IsCyclic.card_pow_eq_one_le) uses `Finset.filter`. One could change the Finset to a Set (and use `Nat.card`/`Set.ncard` and `Finite` instead of `Fintype`) in the statement, but it's out of scope of this PR.
I cannot see this lemma used in the previous additions. Is it?

```suggestion
@[to_additive AddMonoidHom.surjective_of_card_ker_le_div]
```
`MonoidHom.surjective_of_card_ker_le_div` is used in `unitsMap_norm_surjective`; the additive version is not used. However there is a typo in the additive version (wrong namespace) which I'm now correcting.

pullRequest.title: feat(FieldTheory/Finite): surjectivity of norm
